tie_knot.text: You tie a knot with the precision of a master craftsman. It's either a perfect blood knot or you've accidentally invented a new form of modern art.
Your knot-tying session results in what can only be described as a three-dimensional puzzle that would challenge a mathematician.

clean_glasses.text: You clean your glasses with meticulous care. The world comes into sharp focus, revealing just how badly your last cast went.
You clean your glasses, only to realize the problem wasn't your vision - reality really is this absurd.

adjust_hat.text: You adjust your hat to the perfect angle of scholarly contemplation. You feel 23% more distinguished.
You adjust your hat, but it seems to have developed its own opinions about proper positioning.

change_fly.text: You select a different fly with the care of a wine connoisseur choosing a vintage. This one has 'success' written all over it.
You change flies with scientific precision, though the fish appear to have formed a committee to discuss your tactical choices.

check_time.text: Your pocket watch indicates it's precisely the time when fish traditionally ignore all human endeavors. How convenient.
According to your calculations, you've been fishing for exactly long enough to question all your life choices.

check_weather.text: The weather is behaving with typical British unpredictability. It's simultaneously perfect for fishing and completely wrong for fishing.
The meteorological conditions suggest that somewhere, in a parallel universe, you're probably catching fish.
